Welcome to randnames’s documentation!¶

Main module for randnames

Simple usage: >>> import randomname >>> randomname.full_name() ‘John Doe’

randname.randname.available_countries() → set¶

Return set of available countries

Returns

set of available countries

Return type

set

>>> available_countries()
{'ES', 'PL', 'US'}
randname.randname.data_lookup() → dict¶

Return dictionary with imformation about database.

Returns

information about database

Return type

dict

>>> data_lookup()
{
    'ES': {'first_names': ['M'], 'last_names': ['N']}, 
    'PL': {'first_names': ['M', 'F'], 'last_names': ['M', 'F']},
    'US': {'first_names': ['M', 'F'], 'last_names': ['N']}
}
randname.randname.database_path = '/home/SharedFolder/Git/random-names/randname/data'¶

database_path - set dirrection to external database

>>> randname.database_path = "path_to_your_database"
randname.randname.first_name(year: Optional[int] = None, sex: Optional[str] = None, country: Optional[str] = None, weights: bool = True) → str¶

Return random first name

Parameters

  • year (int, optional) – year of source database, defaults to None

  • sex (str, optional) – first name gender, defaults to None

Raises

  • YearNotInRange – If year is not in valid range

  • InvalidSexArgument – If invalid sex argument

Returns

first name as string

Return type

str

>>> first_name()
'John'
randname.randname.full_name(year: Optional[int] = None, first_sex: Optional[str] = None, last_sex: Optional[str] = None, country: Optional[str] = None, weights: bool = True) → str¶

Return random first and las name

Parameters

  • year (int, optional) – year of source database, defaults to None

  • sex (str, optional) – first name gender, defaults to None

Returns

full name as string

Return type

str

>>> full_name()
'John Doe'
randname.randname.get_name(name: str, year: Optional[int] = None, sex: Optional[str] = None, country: Optional[str] = None, weights: bool = True) → str¶

private finction to get either first or last name

Parameters

  • name (str) – “first_name” or “last_name”

  • year (int, optional) – year of source database, defaults to None

  • sex (str, optional) – name gender, defaults to None

  • country (str, optional) – database country, defaults to None

  • weights (bool, optional) – include weights in database, defaults to True

Raises

InvalidSexArgument – raise when provided sex is not available for given database

Returns

name from database

Return type

str

>>> get_name("first")
"John"
>>> get_name("last")
"Doe"
randname.randname.last_name(year: Optional[int] = None, sex: Optional[str] = None, country: Optional[str] = None, weights: bool = True) → str¶

Return random last name

Parameters

  • year (int, optional) – year of source database, defaults to None

  • country (str, optional) – select database country, defaults to False

Raises

YearNotInRange – throw error if year is not in valid range

Returns

last name as string

Return type

str

>>> last_name()
'Doe'
